isis.stitle: VT-365 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (2002) - DIAGNOSTIC SOFTWARE OPERATION - Diagnostic Tests - Key On Engine Off Tests

svcsubproc.title: Standard Test
svcsubproc.para: The Standard Test is done by the ECM. The technician runs this test, using the EST or the CRUISE ON and RESUME/ACCEL switches.
During the Standard Test, the ECM does an internal test of its processing components and memory.

The ECM automatically does an Output Circuit Check (OCC). By operating the ECM output circuits and measuring each individual response, the Standard Test detects shorts or opens in the harnesses, actuators, and ECM. If a circuit fails the test, a fault is logged and a DTC is set.
The ECM checks the following circuits:
The OCC evaluates the electrical condition of the circuits, not mechanical or hydraulic performance of the systems.
When the OCC is done, the Diagnostics Trouble Code window will display DTCs, if there are problems.

step1.para: Set parking brake for the correct signal from the Electronic System Controller (ESC).
Turn the ignition switch ON. (Do not start the engine.)
Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key On Engine Off Tests from the drop down menu.
From the Key On Engine Off Diagnostics menu, select Standard Test and click Run to start the test.

figure.caption: Switches for CRUISE ON and RESUME ACCELERATION

step1.para: Set parking brake for the correct signal from the Electronic System Controller (ESC).
Turn the ignition switch ON. (Do not start the engine.)
Press and release the CRUISE ON and RESUME/ACCEL switches at the same time, twice within 3 seconds of key ON.

item.para: The ECM will begin the Output Circuit Check (OCC). If DTCs are detected, the ECM will flash the amber ENGINE lamp.
When the OCC is done, the ECM will flash the red ENGINE and amber ENGINE to signal the DTCs.

note.para: There will be a 10 second delay from the time switches are pressed to the time DTCs are flashed.

svcsubproc.title: Injector Test

specpara.para: This test can only be done with the EST; Master Diagnostics software is required. The Standard Test must be done before doing the Injector Test.

svcsubproc.para: The Injector Test diagnoses electrical problems in fuel delivery components.

note.para: Before doing the Injector Test, DTCs should be accessed, noted and erased. This allows DTCs found to be displayed as Active DTCs.

svcsubproc.para: During the test, the ECM actuates the injectors in numerical order (1 through 8), not in firing order. The ECM monitors the electrical circuit for each injector, evaluates the performance of the injectors coils, and checks the operation of the electrical circuit. If an electronic component in the fuel system fails the expected parameters, a DTC is set and transmitted to the EST.

note.para: The technician can monitor injector operation by listening to the sound each injector produces as it is activated by the IDM; however, in Hard Start and No Start conditions, when oil may be very cold and thick, injectors may not be heard.

svcsubproc.para: The Diagnostics Trouble Code window will display DTCs, if there are problems.

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key On Engine Off Tests from the drop down menu.
From the Key On Engine Off Diagnsotics menu, select Injector Test and click Run to start the test.

note.para: During this test, injector solenoids should click when actuated. If a series of clicks are not heard for each injector, one or more injectors are not activating.

svcsubproc.title: Continuous Monitor Test

specpara.para: This test can only be done with the EST; Master Diagnostics software is required.

svcsubproc.para: The Continuous Monitor Test troubleshoots intermittent connections at sensors and actuators. The engine can be off or running.
The EST monitors the following circuits:

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key On Engine Off Tests from the drop down menu.
From the Key On Engine Off Diagnostics menu, select Continuous Monitor Test, and click Run to start the test.
Wiggle connectors and wires at all suspected problem locations. If circuit continuity is interrupted, the EST will BEEP and display DTCs related to the condition.

svcsubproc.title: Glow Plug Output State Test

specpara.para: This test can only be done with the EST; Master Diagnostics software is required.

svcsubproc.para: The Glow Plug Output State Test allows the technician to determine if the Glow Plug System is operating correctly.
Selecting this test activates the Glow Plug relay for 120 seconds at a time; a DMM and current clamp are used to measure on time and amperage draw off the glow plugs.

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key On Engine Off Tests from the drop down menu.
From the Key On Engine Off Diagnostics menu, select Glow Plug Output State Test, and click Run to start the test.

svcsubproc.title: Output State Low Test

specpara.para: This test can only be done with the EST; Master Diagnostics software is required.

svcsubproc.para: The Output State Low Test allows the technician to diagnose the operation of the output signals and actuators.
In the Output State Low Test mode the ECM pulls down the output voltage to their low state. This actuates the output components controlled by the ECM, grounding the circuits.

During this test, the output of the circuit in question can be monitored with a DMM. The DMM measures a low voltage state as the outputs are toggled. The actual voltage will vary with the circuit tested.

item.para: A breakout box or breakout harness and a DMM are required to monitor the suspected circuit or actuator.
DTCs are not set by the ECM during this test.

svcsubproc.para: The following actuators are activated when toggled low during the test:

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key On Engine Off Tests from the drop down menu.
From the Key On Engine Off Diagnostics menu, select Output State Low Test, and click Run to start the test.

svcsubproc.title: Output State High Test
svcsubproc.para: This test can only be done with the EST; Master Diagnostics software is required.
The Output State High Test allows the technician to diagnose the operation of the output signals and actuators.
In the Output State High Test mode the ECM pulls up the output voltage to their high state. This actuates the output components controlled by the ECM, energizing the control circuits.

During this test, the output of the circuit in question is monitored with a DMM. The DMM measures a high voltage state, as the outputs are toggled. The actual voltage will vary with the circuit tested.

item.para: A breakout box or breakout harness and a DMM are required to monitor the suspected circuit or actuator.
DTCs are not set by the ECM during this test.

svcsubproc.para: The following actuators are activated when toggled high during the test:

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key On Engine Off Tests from the drop down menu.
From the Key On Engine Off Diagnostics menu, select Output State High Test, and click Run to start the test.
